content: p6 k6 to last 12 sts p6 k4 kfb x2 r2 k1 kfb p6 k6 to the last 6 sts p4 p2tog 204 sts r3 k5 p6 k6 to last 3 sts p1 kfb x2 190 sts r22 k1 kfb p6 k6 to last 2 sts p2tog r4 k1 kfb k3 p6 k6 to last 5 sts p3 p2tog r23 k1 p6 k6 to last 3 sts p1 kfb x2 206 sts r5 k4 p6 k6 to last 6 sts p4 kfb x2 192 sts r24 k1 kfb k3 p6 k6 to last 13 sts p6 p5 r6 p1 pfb k6 p6 to last 10 sts k6 p2 p2tog k2tog do not fasten_off now you can set these stitch on r7 p3 k6 p6 to last 9 sts k6 p1 kfb x2 hold while you pick up for the i-cord or switch to 194 sts longer circular needles r8 k1 kfb k3 p6 k6 to last 9 sts p6 k1 k2tog 8 www unrulystitch com- instagram @unrulystitch pattern i-cord setup live stitches c a starting at c you will want to pick up and knit in a knit purl pattern to b making sure you are picking up the very last stitch from every row 182 sts pm omit marker if you are using crochet bobble b from b to a you will now pick up in the same pattern k1 p1 274 st pick up 3 sts per 2 row to finish off your shawl pick your i-cord edge either crochet bobble or knitted bobble option 1 knit i-cord with knitted bobble cable cast on 3 sts k3 sts sl 3 sts back to left needle *k the first 2 sts k2tog tbl sl these 3 st back to left needle * repeat *to* around until you reach the stitch marker working from a to b remove maker r1 k1 mb k2tog tbl r2-4 repeat *to* above you will repeat r1-4 until you reach the corner c of your shawl you will now repeat *to* above until you have 3 sts left you can graft these sts to the first 3 sts of the i-cord by binding off and stitching the 2 ends together or by using the kitchener stitch method with the live sts hide all loose ends and block your shawl using the measurements on the last page option 2 knit i-cord with crochet bobble cable cast on 3 sts k3 sts sl 3 sts back to left needle *k the first 2 sts k2tog tbl sl these 3 st back to left needle * repeat *to* around until you have 3 sts left you can graft these sts to the first 3 sts of the i-cord by binding off and stitching the 2 ends together or by using the kitchener stitch method with the live sts 9 www unrulystitch com- instagram @unrulystitch pattern knit i-cord with crochet bobble cont let s finish up by adding the puff stitches to one edge of your scarf you can
